content:
To list the files in a folder on the terminal in Windows, you can use the command `dir`.

For example, if you want to list the files in the "Downloads" folder located on the C drive, you would open the Command Prompt and type:
```
C:
cd C:\Users\YourUsername\Downloads
dir
```
The `dir` command will list the files and folders in the "Downloads" folder.

You can also use the `ls` command on windows if you have installed Git Bash or any other unix-like shell terminal.

You can also use the command `ls -l` to see the details like permissions, size, owner, and timestamps for the files and folders in the directory.

You can also use the command `ls -a` to list hidden files in the current directory.

If you have many files and you want to see the list in a more organized way, you can use the command `ls -lh` to see the list of files with size in human readable format.
